type Query {
    """
    The search method serves as an entry point to the various results across multiple Atlassian products.
    This method proxy to Search Platform's API xpsearch-aggregator.
    It supports multi tenant search with product specific filtering.
    """
    search: SearchQueryAPI
}

"""
Entry point for all searches
"""
type SearchQueryAPI {

    """
    Searches for some entities
    """
    search(

        """
        Query to search
        """
        query: String

        """
        This object determines the tenants/locations where the search should be performed.
        It also determines the kind of results which must be returned.

        As this supports multiple products and each products have different set of filters.
        The implementation is split by the product.
        """
        filters: SearchFilterInput

        """
        Contains metadata on any analytics related fields, these do not affect the search
        """
        analytics: SearchAnalyticsInput

        """
        String describing which experience the search is being called from, e.g. confluence.advanced_search
        """
        experience: String!

        """
        Used to determine the result size
        """
        first: Int

    ): SearchItemConnection!
}



"""
Metadata on any analytics related fields, these do not affect the search
"""
input SearchAnalyticsInput {
    queryVersion: Int
    searchSessionId: String
    searchReferrerId: String
}

type SearchResultItemEdge {
    """
    The search result object, this is a union type of all possible search result types.
    A different definition will be provided for all entities supported by Atlassian
    """
    node: SearchResult

    """
    Opaque string containing the cursor for this edge
    """
    cursor: String

}

type SearchItemConnection {
    """
    The search result items as per pagination specs
    """
    edges: [SearchResultItemEdge!]!

    """
    The page info as per pagination specs
    """
    pageInfo: PageInfo!

    """

    """
    totalCount: Int
}


"""
Filters to apply to a search
"""
input SearchFilterInput {
    """
    ATI strings of which entities to search for
    """
    entities: [String!]!

    """
    ARIs of which workspaces, cloudIds or orgs to search in
    """
    locations: [String!]!

    """
    Confluence specific filters
    """

}

input SearchConfluenceFilter {

    AccountIds of the users.
    """

type Query {
        """
        This field is useful for testing the graphql API.  In fact here at Atlassian we run synthetic checks
        using this field ot help us ensure the graphql API is working as expected.
        """
        testing: Testing


        movie(id: ID!): TestingMovie
    }

    type Testing @scopes(required: READ_JIRA_WORK) {
        """
        Echos the message argument back to the caller
        """
        echo(message: String): String
        """
        Generates a new UUID
        """
        uuid: String
        """
        Creates a graphql error with the specified argument text and always returns null as a value
        """
        error(message: String): String @atlassian
        """
        This simulates throwing an exception during data fetching with the provided argument text as the exception message
        """
        throwException(message: String): String @atlassian

        """
        This returns a hypothetical Movie by id for testing purposes
        """
        movie(id: ID!): TestingMovie @scopes(required: READ_JIRA_WORK)
        """
        This returns a list of hypothetical Movies for testing purposes
        """
        movies: [TestingMovie]
        """
        This is a field used for performance testing.  It was based on one our early Activity APIs so
        it has a more meaningful shape
        """
        performance : TestingPerformance @atlassian
    }

    type TestingCharacter @renamed(from : "Character")  {
        id: ID!
        name: String
    }

    type TestingMovie @renamed(from : "Movie") {
        id: ID!
        renamedName: String @renamed(from : "name")
        characters: [TestingCharacter] @hydrated(service: "testing" field: "characters" arguments : [{ name:"ids" value:"$source.characterIds"}] identifiedBy : "id" batchSize : 2 )
    }


    """
    These represent the entry point to performance related fields
    """
    type TestingPerformance @renamed(from : "Performance") {
        myActivities: TestingMyActivity!
    }

    enum TestingActivityEventType @renamed(from : "ActivityEventType") {
        ASSIGNED
        UNASSIGNED
        VIEWED
        COMMENTED
        UPDATED
        CREATED
        LIKED
        TRANSITIONED
        PUBLISHED
        EDITED
    }

    type TestingMyActivity {
        workedOn(howMany : Int = 100, howManyContainers : Int = 5, howManyContributors : Int = 2, inducedDelay : Int = 0): TestingActivityConnection!
        viewed(howMany : Int = 100, howManyContainers : Int = 5, howManyContributors : Int = 2, inducedDelay : Int = 0): TestingActivityConnection!
    }

    type TestingActivityConnection @renamed(from : "ActivityConnection") {
        nodes: [TestingActivityItem]!
    }

    type TestingActivityItem implements Node @renamed(from : "ActivityItem") {
        id: ID!
        timestamp: String
        eventType: TestingActivityEventType
        object: TestingActivityObject
        containers: [TestingActivityObject]
        contributors: [TestingActivityContributor]
    }

    type TestingActivityObject implements Node  @renamed(from : "ActivityObject") {
        id: ID!
        name: String
        cloudID: String
        url: String
        iconURL: String
    }

    type TestingActivityContributor  @renamed(from : "ActivityContributor") {
        profile: TestingActivityUser
    }

    }

        If not specified it's assumed as the cursor for the item before the beginning.

        after: String

        If not specified, it is up to the server to determine a page size.

An operator in JQL is one or more symbols or words,which compares the value of a field on its left with one or more values (or functions) on its right,

  The `IN` operator is used to search for issues where the value of the specified field is one of multiple specified values.

  """

  """

  IS
  """
  The `IS NOT` operator can only be used with EMPTY or NULL. That is, it is used to search for issues where the specified field has a value.
  """
  IS_NOT
  """
  The `<` operator is used to search for issues where the value of the specified field is less than the specified value.
  """
  LESS_THAN
  """
  The `<=` operator is used to search for issues where the value of the specified field is less than or equal to than the specified value.

  LESS_THAN_OR_EQUAL
  """
  The `>` operator is used to search for issues where the value of the specified field is greater than the specified value.

  GREATER_THAN
  """
  The `>=` operator is used to search for issues where the value of the specified field is greater than or equal to the specified value.

  GREATER_THAN_OR_EQUAL

  NOT_CONTAINS
  """
  The `WAS NOT IN` operator is used to search for issues where the value of the specified field has never been one of multiple specified values.
  """
  WAS_NOT_IN
  """
  The `CHANGED` operator is used to find issues that have a value that had changed for the specified field.
  """
  CHANGED
  """
  The `WAS IN` operator is used to find issues that currently have or previously had any of multiple specified values for the specified field.
  """
  WAS_IN
  """
  The `WAS` operator is used to find issues that currently have or previously had the specified value for the specified field.
  """
  WAS
  """
  The `WAS NOT` operator is used to find issues that have never had the specified value for the specified field.

"""
Cascading options can either be a parent or a child - this enum captures this characteristic.

E.g. If there is a parent cascading option named `P1`, it may or may not have
child cascading options named `C1` and `C2`.
- `P1` would be a `PARENT` enum
- `C1` and `C2` would be `CHILD` enums
"""

  Parent option only
  """
  PARENT
  """
  Child option only
  """
  CHILD
  """
  All options, regardless of whether they're a parent or child.
  """
  ALL
}

"""
Jira application properties is effectively a key/value store scoped to a Jira instance. A JiraApplicationProperty
represents one of these key/value pairs, along with associated metadata about the property.
"""
type JiraApplicationProperty implements Node {

    """

    """
    Although all application properties are stored as strings, they notionally have a type (e.g. boolean, int, enum,
    string). The type can be anything (for example, there is even a colour type), and there may be associated validation
    on the server based on the property's type.
    """
    type: String!,

    """
    The value of the application property, encoded as a string. If no value is stored the default value will
    be returned.
    """
    value: String!,

    """
    The default value which will be returned if there is no value stored. This might be useful for UIs which allow a
    user to 'reset' an application property to the default value.
    """
    defaultValue: String!,

    """
    The human readable name for the application property. If no human readable name has been defined then the key will
    be returned.
    """
    name: String!,

    """
    The human readable description for the application property
    """
    description: String,

    """
    Example is mostly used for application properties which store some sort of format pattern (e.g. date formats).
    Example will contain an example string formatted according to the format stored in the property.
    """
    example: String,

    """
    If the type is 'enum', then allowedValues may optionally contain a list of values which are valid for this property.
    Otherwise the value will be null.
    """
    allowedValues: [String!],

    """
    True if the user is allowed to edit the property, false otherwise
    """
    isEditable: Boolean!
}

"""
The unique key of the grant type such as PROJECT_ROLE.
"""
type JiraGrantTypeKey {
    "The key to identify the grant type such as PROJECT_ROLE."
    key: JiraGrantTypeKeyEnum!
    "The display name of the grant type key such as Project Role."
    name: String!
}

"""
The grant type key enum represents all the possible grant types available in Jira.
A grant type may take an optional parameter value.
For example: PROJECT_ROLE grant type takes project role id as parameter. And, PROJECT_LEAD grant type do not.

The actual ARI formats are documented on the various concrete grant type values.
"""
enum JiraGrantTypeKeyEnum {
    """
    A role that user/group can play in a project.
    It takes project role as parameter.
    """
    PROJECT_ROLE

    """
    A application role is used to grant a user/group access to the application group.
    It takes application role as parameter.
    """
    APPLICATION_ROLE

    """
    An individual user who can be given the access to work on one or more projects.
    It takes user account id as parameter.
    """
    USER

    """
    A group is a collection of users who can be given access together.
    It represents group in the organization's user base.
    It takes group id as parameter.
    """
    GROUP

    """
    A multi user picker custom field.
    It takes multi user picker custom field id as parameter.
    """
    MULTI_USER_PICKER

    """
    A multi group picker custom field.
    It takes multi group picker custom field id as parameter.
    """
    MULTI_GROUP_PICKER

    """
    The grant type defines what the customers can do from the portal view.
    It takes no parameter.
    """
    SERVICE_PROJECT_CUSTOMER_PORTAL_ACCESS

    """
    The issue reporter role.
    It takes platform defined 'reporter' as parameter to represent the issue field value.
    """
    REPORTER

    """
    The project lead role.
    It takes no parameter.
    """
    PROJECT_LEAD

    """
    The issue assignee role.
    It takes platform defined 'assignee' as parameter to represent the issue field value.
    """
    ASSIGNEE

    """
    The anonymous access represents the public access without logging in.
    It takes no parameter.
    """
    ANONYMOUS_ACCESS

    """
    Any user who has the product access.
    It takes no parameter.
    """
    ANY_LOGGEDIN_USER_APPLICATION_ROLE
}

"""
The default grant type with only id and name to return data for grant types such as PROJECT_LEAD, APPLICATION_ROLE,
ANY_LOGGEDIN_USER_APPLICATION_ROLE, ANONYMOUS_ACCESS, SERVICE_PROJECT_CUSTOMER_PORTAL_ACCESS
"""
type JiraDefaultGrantTypeValue implements Node {
    """
    The ARI to represent the default grant type value.

    APPLICATION_ROLE ari for JSM - ari:cloud:jira-servicedesk::role/123
    ANY_LOGGEDIN_USER_APPLICATION_ROLE ari - ari:cloud:jira::role/product/member
    ANONYMOUS_ACCESS ari - ari:cloud:identity::user/unidentified
    """
    id: ID!
    "The display name of the grant type value such as GROUP."
    name: String!
}

The USER grant type value where user data is provided by identity service.

type JiraQuery {
    jiraProject(
        id: ID! @ARI(type: "project", owner: "jira")
    ): JiraProject

    """
    Returns a paginated connection of projects that meet the provided filter criteria
    """
    allJiraProjects(
        """
        The identifier that indicates that cloud instance this data is to be fetched for
        """
        cloudId: ID! @CloudID,

        """The number of items to be sliced away to target between the after and before cursors"""
        first: Int,
        last: Int,

        """The index based cursor to specify the beginning of the items, if not specified it's assumed as the cursor for the item before the beginning"""
        after: String,
        before: String,

        """the filter criteria that is used to filter the projects"""
        filter: JiraProjectFilterInput!
    ): JiraProjectConnection

    """
    Returns a paginated connection of project categories
    """
    allJiraProjectCategories(
        """
        The identifier that indicates that cloud instance this data is to be fetched for
        """
        cloudId: ID! @CloudID,
        """The number of items to be sliced away to target between the after and before cursors"""
        first: Int,
        last: Int,

        """The index based cursor to specify the beginning of the items, if not specified it's assumed as the cursor for the item before the beginning"""
        after: String,
        before: String,
    ): JiraProjectCategoryConnection
}

input JiraProjectFilterInput {
    """the project types that can be used to filter list of projects"""
    types: [JiraProjectType!]

    """the project category that can be used to filter list of projects"""
    projectCategoryId: ID @ARI(type: "project-category", owner: "jira")

    """ Filter the results using a literal string. Projects witha matching key or name are returned (case insensitive)."""
    keyword: String

    """the sort criteria that is used while filtering the projects"""
    sortBy: JiraProjectSortInput
}

"""The sort direction of the collection"""
enum SortDirection {

"""
Option parameters to fetch pricing plan for a marketplace entity
"""
input MarketplacePricingPlanOptions {
    """
    Period for which Pricing Plan is to be fetched. Defaults to MONTHLY
    """
    billingCycle: MarketplaceBillingCycle
    """
    Fetch pricing plan with status: LIVE, PENDING, DRAFT. Unless, pricing plan will be fetched based on user access
    """
    planStatus: MarketplacePricingPlanStatus
    """
    Currency code (ISO 4217) to return the amount in pricing items. Either of currencyCode and countryCode is needed. If currency code is not present, fallback to country code to fetch currency
    """
    currencyCode: String
    """
    Country code (ISO 3166-1 alpha-2) of the client. Either of currencyCode and countryCode is needed. If both are not present, fallback to default currency - USD
    """
    countryCode: String
}

"""
Pricing plan for a marketplace entity
"""
type MarketplacePricingPlan {
    """
    Billing cycle of the marketplace entity
    """
    billingCycle: MarketplaceBillingCycle!
    """
    Currency code for all items in the pricing plan. Defaults to USD
    """
    currency: String!
    """
    Status of the plan : LIVE, PENDING or DRAFT
    """
    status: MarketplacePricingPlanStatus!
    """
    Tiered Pricing for the plan
    """
    tieredPricing: MarketplaceTieredPricing!
}

"""
Tiered pricing object for pricing plan
"""
type MarketplaceTieredPricing {
    """
    Type of the tier
    """
    tierType: MarketplacePricingTierType!
    """
    Mode of the tier : GRADUATED (progressive PUP), VOLUME (constant for all users)
    """
    tiersMode: MarketplacePricingTierMode!
    """
    List of pricing items
    """
    items: [MarketplacePricingItem!]!
}

"""
Pricing items based on tiers
"""
type MarketplacePricingItem {
    """
    The lower limit for unit count (number of users of Jira, remote agents in Bamboo) defining this pricing tier
    """
    floor: Int!
    """
    The upper limit for unit count (number of users of Jira, remote agents in Bamboo) defining this pricing tier. Null in case of highest tier
    """
    ceiling: Int
    """
    The amount that a customer pays for a license at this tier
    """
    amount: Float!
    """
    Policy of the tier : BLOCK (FLAT) or PER_UNIT (PUP)
    """
    policy: MarketplacePricingTierPolicy!
}

"""
Mode of the tier : GRADUATED (progressive PUP), VOLUME (constant for all users)
"""
enum  MarketplacePricingTierMode {
    GRADUATED, VOLUME
}

"""
Policy of the tier : BLOCK (FLAT) or PER_UNIT (PUP)
"""
enum MarketplacePricingTierPolicy {
    BLOCK, PER_UNIT
}

"""
Type of the tier
"""
enum MarketplacePricingTierType {
    USER_TIERED,
    REMOTE_AGENT_TIERED
}

"""
Billing cycle for which pricing plan applies
"""
enum MarketplaceBillingCycle {
    ANNUAL,
    MONTHLY
}

"""
Status of the plan : LIVE, PENDING or DRAFT
"""
enum MarketplacePricingPlanStatus {
    LIVE,
    PENDING,
    DRAFT
}

type PolarisPresentation {
    """
    The type of presentation.  Intended to select the UI control for this
    field.
    """
    type: String!
    parameters: JSON
}

"""
An PolarisIdeaField is a unit of information that can be instantiated
for an PolarisIdea.
"""
interface PolarisIdeaField {
    """
    The fully qualified globally unique id (ARI) for this field
    """
    id: ID!

    """
    The key of this field in the `fields` structure if it is a Jira
    field.  Not set for things that don't appear in the fields section
    of a Jira issue object, such as "key"
    """
    jiraFieldKey: String

    """
    A short identifier suitable for at least within this project,
    but only supplied for fields that are returned via an PolarisIdea's fields
    attribute.  If not present, this field represents a builtin field
    on PolarisIdea.
    """
    fieldId: Int        @deprecated

    """
    The name of the field built in to PolarisIdea, if this field represents
    a builtin field.
    """
    fieldName: String        @deprecated

    label: String!

    """
    Are values in this field directly editable?  Some integrations
    might bring in data that is not directly editable.
    """
    editable: Boolean!

    """
    Can rows be sorted by this field?  Some fields are not commensurate
    and hence can't be sorted.
    """
    sortable: Boolean!

    """
    Is this field suitable for grouping operations like Board view?
    (i.e., may it appear in the groupBy field in a view?)
    """
    groupable: Boolean!

    """
    Is this field suitable for linear operations like plotting on an axis?
    (i.e., may it appear in the x or y field in a view?)
    """
    linearizable: Boolean!

    """
    What is the default sort order?  This is the order you get on
    "first click" of the column, and also the semantics of "ORDER BY"
    without an ASC or DESC qualifier.
    """
    defaultSortOrder: PolarisSortOrder

    """
    Values stored in this field can be decorated with visual elements
    (emojis, colors, backgrounds) for distinction. For discrete types
    such as Single/Multi select these will typically be exact matches
    on the static values allowed by the field. For orderable types
    such as strings, dates, numbers, etc decorations will more
    commonly be applied using ranges.
    """
    decorations: [PolarisDecoration!]

    """
    Refines how we should present the field.  For example, a number
    field might be presented with a Rating picker.
    """
    presentation: PolarisPresentation

    """
    The formula for calculated fields; null for regular (stored) fields
    """
    formula: JSON

    """
    Description
    """
    description: String

    """
    Field emoji
    """
    emoji: String

    """
    An identifier for fields built in to Jira or Polaris.  For example, "Key" and
    "Delivery progress" are builtin fields.
    """
    builtin: BuiltinPolarisIdeaField
}

## Types

type PolarisInsight {
    """
    ARI of the insight, for example:

       `ari:cloud:cebeacbd-f85e-483c-96ac-fd432a12ad1c:polaris-insight/10004`
    """
    id: ID!

    """
    The ID of the object within the project which contains this data
    point (nee insight), if any.  In the usual case, if not null, this
    is an idea (issue) ARI
    """
    container: ID

    """
    AAID of the user who owns the insight
    """
    aaid: String!

    """
    Description in ADF format.  See
    https://developer.atlassian.com/platform/atlassian-document-format/
    """
    description: JSON

    """
    Array of snippets attached to this data point.
    """
    snippets: [PolarisSnippet!]!

    """
    Creation time of data point in RFC3339 format
    """
    created: String!

    """
    Updated time of data point in RFC3339 format
    """
    updated: String!

account: User  => hydrated from identity.users(accountIds: $source.aaid) object identified by accountId, batch size 90,
}

input CreatePolarisInsightInput {
    """
    The cloudID in which we are adding insight
    """
    cloudID: String!
    """
    The projectID in which we are adding insight
    """
    projectID: Int!
    """
    The issueID in which we are adding insight, cloud be empty for adding insight on project level
    """
    issueID: Int

    """
    DEPRECATED, DO NOT USE
    Array of datas in JSON format. It will be validated with JSON schema of Polaris Insights Data format.
    """
    data: [JSON!]

    """
    Array of snippets
    """
    snippets: [CreatePolarisSnippetInput!]
    """
    Description in ADF format https://developer.atlassian.com/platform/atlassian-document-format/
    """
    description: JSON
}

input CopyPolarisInsightsContainerInput {
    """
    The project ARI which contains container
    """
    project: ID!
    """
    The container ARI which contains insights
    """
    container: ID
}

input CopyPolarisInsightsInput {
    """
    Source container to copy insgihts
    """
    source: CopyPolarisInsightsContainerInput!
    """
    Destination container to copy insgihts
    """
    destination: CopyPolarisInsightsContainerInput!
    """
    Insight ARI's list that should be copied. Leave it empty to copy all insights from source to destination
    """
    insights: [String!]
}

input UpdatePolarisInsightInput {
    description: JSON
    snippets: [UpdatePolarisSnippetInput!]
}

## Mutations

extend type Mutation {
    """
    Creates a new play.  A play will manifest as a field, and play
    contributions will manifest as insights (data points) with
    snippets associated with the play.

    THIS OPERATION IS IN BETA
    """
    createPolarisPlay(input: CreatePolarisPlayInput!): CreatePolarisPlayPayload @beta(name: "polaris-v0")

    """

    Creates or updates a contribution to a play.  The contribution
    will manifest as an insight.  Returns an error if the contribution
    is not acceptable to the parameters of the play, such as spending
    more than the max amount in a BudgetAllocation ("$10 Game") play

    THIS OPERATION IS IN BETA
    """
    createPolarisPlayContribution(input: CreatePolarisPlayContribution!): CreatePolarisPlayContributionPayload @beta(name: "polaris-v0")

    """
    Updates an existing contribution to a play.

    THIS OPERATION IS IN BETA
    """
    updatePolarisPlayContribution(id: ID!, input: UpdatePolarisPlayContribution!): UpdatePolarisPlayContributionPayload @beta(name: "polaris-v0")

    """
    Deletes an existing contribution to a play.

    THIS OPERATION IS IN BETA
    """
    deletePolarisPlayContribution(id: ID!): DeletePolarisPlayContributionPayload @beta(name: "polaris-v0")

    """
    Creates a new data point from a play contribution

    THIS OPERATION IS IN BETA
    """
    createPolarisInsightFromPlayContribution(input: CreatePolarisInsightFromPlayContributionInput): CreatePolarisInsightPayload @beta(name: "polaris-v0")
}

## Types

extend type PolarisProject {
    plays: [PolarisPlay!]
    play(id: ID!): PolarisPlay
}

extend type PolarisInsight {
    play: PolarisPlay           # if an insight is from a play, a link to the play
    contribs: [PolarisPlayContribution!]        # if an insight is from a play, the associated contributions
}

input CreatePolarisPlayContribution {
    play: ID!       # the play being contributed to
    subject: ID!    # the issue (idea) to which this contribution is being made
    amount: Int     # the extent of the contribution (null=drop value)
    comment: JSON   # the comment (null=drop value)
}

input UpdatePolarisPlayContribution {
    amount: Int     # the extent of the contribution (null=drop value)
    comment: ID     # the comment (null=drop value, which is not permitted; delete the contribution if needed)
    content: JSON   # optional comment content to update
}

type CreatePolarisPlayContributionPayload {
    success: Boolean!
    errors: [MutationError!]
    node: PolarisPlayContribution
}

type UpdatePolarisPlayContributionPayload {
    success: Boolean!
    errors: [MutationError!]
    node: PolarisPlayContribution
}

type DeletePolarisPlayContributionPayload {
    success: Boolean!
    errors: [MutationError!]
}

extend enum PolarisFieldType {
    PolarisIdeaPlayField
}

type PolarisIdeaPlayField implements PolarisIdeaField {
    id: ID!
    fieldId: Int
    fieldName: String
    label: String!
    editable: Boolean!
    sortable: Boolean!
    groupable: Boolean!
    linearizable: Boolean!
    defaultSortOrder: PolarisSortOrder
    jiraFieldKey: String
    decorations: [PolarisDecoration!]
    formula: JSON                       # no formula support for now
    presentation: PolarisPresentation   # probably nothing here for now
    description: String
    emoji: String
    play: PolarisPlay                   # the associated play
    aspect: String                      # the aspect of the play does this field represent (null=default)

}

input CreatePolarisPlayInput {
    project: ID!
    kind: PolarisPlayKind!
    label: String!                      # the label for the play field, and the "short" name of the play
    summary: String
    parameters: JSON
    fromView: ID                        # the view from which the play is created

type PolarisView {
    """
    ARI of the polaris view itself.  For example,

       `ari:cloud:cebeacbd-f85e-483c-96ac-fd432a12ad1c:polaris-view/10003`
    """
    id: ID!

    emoji: String

    tableColumnSizes: [PolarisViewTableColumnSize!] # table column sizes per field

    """
    The JQL that would produce the same set of issues as are returned by
    the ideas connection
    """
    jql(filter: PolarisFilterInput): String

    """
    Can the view be changed in-place?  Immutable views can be the
    source of a clone operation, but it is an error to try to update
    one.
    """
    immutable: Boolean

    # this is being flattened out from the visualization substructure;
    # these view attributes are all modelled as optional, and their
    # significance depends on the selected visualizationType

    visualizationType: PolarisVisualizationType!
    groupBy: PolarisIdeaField
    verticalGroupBy: PolarisIdeaField
    groupValues: [PolarisGroupValue!]
    verticalGroupValues: [PolarisGroupValue!]
    sort: [PolarisSortField!]
    hidden: [PolarisIdeaField!]

    matrixConfig: PolarisMatrixConfig

    The user-supplied part of a JQL filter
    """
    userJql: String

    filter: [PolarisViewFilter!]

    """
    view rank / position
    """
    rank: Int!

    """
    The comment stream
    """
    comments(limit: Int): [PolarisComment!]

    """
    View contains archived ideas
    """
    containsArchived: Boolean!

    lastViewed: [PolarisViewLastViewed]

    collabServiceDelegation: PolarisDelegationToken

}

"Payload to invoke an AUX Effect"
input AuxEffectsInvocationPayload {
    "The current state of the AUX extension"
    state: JSON!

    "The effects to action inside the function"
    effects: [JSON!]!

    "Environment information about where the effects are dispatched from"
    context: JSON!

    "A signed token representing the context information of the extension"
    contextToken: String

    "Configuration arguments for the instance of the AUX extension"
    config: JSON
}

"A response to an aux invocation"
type AuxEffectsResult {
    """
    The list of effects in response to an aux effects invocation.

    Render effects should return valid rendering effects to the invoker,
    to allow the front-end to render the required content. These are kept as
    generic JSON blobs since consumers of this API are responsible for defining
    what these effects look like.
    """
    effects: [JSON!]!
}

"""
Establish tunnels for a specific environment of an app.

This will redirect all function calls to the provided faas url. This URL must implement the same
invocation contract that is used elsewhere in Xen.

This will also be used to redirect Custom UI product rendering to the custom ui urls. We separate
them by extension key.
"""
input CreateAppTunnelsInput {
    "The app to setup a tunnel for"
    appId: ID!

    "The environment key"
    environmentKey: String!

    "The tunnel definitions"
    tunnelDefinitions: TunnelDefinitionsInput!

    "Should existing tunnels be overwritten"
    force: Boolean
}

"A response to a tunnel creation request"
type CreateAppTunnelResponse implements Payload {
    success: Boolean!
    errors: [MutationError!]

    """
    The recommended keep-alive time (in milliseconds) by which the forge CLI (or
    other clients) should re-establish the forge tunnel.
    This is guaranteed to be less than the expiry of the forge tunnel.

}

teams:
extend enum RateLimitingCurrency {
    TEAMS_CURRENCY
    TEAM_MEMBERS_CURRENCY
}

type Query {
    team: TeamQuery @apiGroup(name: TEAMS) @namespaced 
}

"""
    Returns the team with the given ARI
"""
type TeamQuery {
    """
    Returns the team with the given ARI
    """
    team(id: ID! @ARI(type: "team", owner: "identity")): Team @rateLimit(cost: 250, currency: TEAMS_CURRENCY) @beta(name: "teams-beta")
}

"""
    Returns the details of the queried team
"""
type Team implements Node {
    """
    ID of the team
    """
    id: ID! @ARI(type: "team", owner: "identity")

    """
    Organisation ID of the team
    """
    organizationId: String

    """
    The details of the member who created the team
    """
    creator: User @hydrated(service: "identity", field: "users", arguments : [{name:"accountIds", value:"$source.creatorId"}], identifiedBy : "accountId", batchSize : 90)

    """
    The state of the team, enum of one of the following: ACTIVE, DISBANDED, PURGED
    """
    state: TeamState

    """
    Display name of the team
    """
    displayName: String
    """
    Description of the team
    """
    description: String

    """
    How members are able to be added to the team, enum of one of the following: OPEN, MEMBER_INVITE, ADMIN_INVITE
    """
    membershipSetting: MembershipSetting

    """
    URL to the small size image of the team header image
    """
    smallHeaderImageUrl: String
    """
    URL to the large size image of the team header image
    """
    largeHeaderImageUrl: String
    """
    URL to the small size image of the team avatar image
    """
    smallAvatarImageUrl: String
    """
    URL to the large size image of the team avatar image
    """
    largeAvatarImageUrl: String

    """
    Returns member data for the 'first' number of members after a cursor denoted by 'after' with membership state 'state'
    If 'after' is null, member data will return from the top of the list of members.
    """
    members(after: String, first: Int! = 100, state: [MembershipState!]! = [FULL_MEMBER]): TeamMemberConnection @rateLimit(cost: 500, currency: TEAM_MEMBERS_CURRENCY) @beta(name: "team-members-beta")
} 

type TeamMemberConnection {
    edges: [TeamMemberEdge]
    nodes: [TeamMember]
    pageInfo: PageInfo!
}

type TeamMemberEdge {
    node: TeamMember
    cursor: String!
}
"""
    Returns the details of the team member and details about their membership within a team
"""
type TeamMember {
    """
    Returns details of the team member
    """
    member: User @hydrated(service: "identity", field: "users", arguments : [{name:"accountIds", value:"$source.memberId"}], identifiedBy : "accountId", batchSize : 90)
    """
    Membership state, enum of one of the following: FULL_MEMBER, ALUMNI, INVITED, REQUESTING_TO_JOIN
    """
    state: MembershipState
    """
    Member's role in the team, enum of one of the following: REGULAR, ADMIN
    """
    role: MembershipRole
}

"""
The states that a team can have
"""
enum TeamState {
    """
    The team is currently active
    """
    ACTIVE,
    """
    The team has been disbanded and is currently inactive
    """
    DISBANDED,
    """
    All members of the team have been deleted 
    """
    PURGED
}

"""
The settings which a team can have describing how members are added to the team
"""
enum MembershipSetting {
    """
    Anyone may join
    """
    OPEN,
    """
    Members may invite others to join the team
    """
    MEMBER_INVITE,
    """
    Only admins may invite others to join the team
    """
    ADMIN_INVITE
}

"""
The states that a member can have within a team
"""
enum MembershipState {
    """
    A full member of the team
    """
    FULL_MEMBER,
    """
    A member who has been invited to the team but has not yet joined
    """
    INVITED,
    """
    A member who was previously a full member of the team, but has been removed or has left the team
    """
    ALUMNI,
    """
    A member who has requested to join the team and is pending approval
    """
    REQUESTING_TO_JOIN
}

"""
The roles that a member can have within a team
"""
enum MembershipRole {
    """
    A regular team member
    """
    REGULAR,
    """
    A team member with administrative permissions
    """
    ADMIN
}

    "Identifies the type of component."

    "A relationship between two components."
    type CompassRelationship {
        "The type of relationship."
        type: CompassRelationshipType!

        "The starting node of the relationship."
        startNode: CompassComponent @scopes(required: [READ_COMPASS_COMPONENT], product: COMPASS)

        "The ending node of the relationship."
        endNode: CompassComponent @scopes(required: [READ_COMPASS_COMPONENT], product: COMPASS)

        changeMetadata: CompassChangeMetadata
    }

    "Defines the relationship types. A relationship must be one of these types."
    enum CompassRelationshipType {
        DEPENDS_ON
    }

    "Defines the possible relationship directions between components."
    enum CompassRelationshipDirection {
        "Going from the other component to this component."
        INWARD

        "Going from this component to the other component."
        OUTWARD
    }

    "Accepts input for finding component relationships."
    input CompassRelationshipQuery {
        "The number of relationships to return in the query."
        first: Int

        "The relationships to be returned after the specified cursor position."
        after: String

        "The direction of relationships to be searched for."
        direction: CompassRelationshipDirection! = OUTWARD

        "The filters for the relationships to be searched for."
        filters: CompassRelationshipQueryFilters
    }

    input CompassRelationshipQueryFilters {
        "OR'd set of relationship types."
        types: [CompassRelationshipType!]
    }

    union CompassRelationshipConnectionResult = CompassRelationshipConnection | QueryError

    type CompassRelationshipConnection {
        edges: [CompassRelationshipEdge!]
        nodes: [CompassRelationship!]
        pageInfo: PageInfo!
    }

    type CompassRelationshipEdge {
        cursor: String!
        node: CompassRelationship
    }

    input CreateCompassRelationshipInput {
        "The type of the relationship."
        type: CompassRelationshipType!

        "The unique identifier (ID) of the component at the starting node."
        startNodeId: ID! @ARI(type: "component", owner: "compass")

        "The unique identifier (ID) of the component at the ending node."
        endNodeId: ID! @ARI(type: "component", owner: "compass")
    }

    "The payload returned from creating a new relationship."
    type CreateCompassRelationshipPayload implements Payload {
        "The newly created relationship between two components."
        createdCompassRelationship: CompassRelationship

        "Whether the mutation was successful or not."
        success: Boolean!

        "A list of errors that occurred during the mutation."
        errors: [MutationError!]
    }

    "Accepts input for deleting an existing relationship between two components."
    input DeleteCompassRelationshipInput {
        "The type of the relationship."
        type: CompassRelationshipType!

        "The unique identifier (ID) of the component at the starting node."
        startNodeId: ID! @ARI(type: "component", owner: "compass")

        "The unique identifier (ID) of the component at the ending node."
        endNodeId: ID! @ARI(type: "component", owner: "compass")
    }

    "The payload returned from deleting an existing component."
    type DeleteCompassRelationshipPayload implements Payload {
        "Whether the mutation was successful or not."
        success: Boolean!

        "A list of errors that occurred during the mutation."
        errors: [MutationError!]
    }

    # COMPASS ANNOUNCEMENTS

    "An announcement communicates news or updates relating to a component."

        "The description of the announcement."

        "The date on which the updates in the announcement will take effect."
        targetDate: DateTime

        "The list of acknowledgements that are required for this announcement."
        acknowledgements: [CompassAnnouncementAcknowledgement!]

    "Tracks whether or not a component has acknowledged an announcement."
    type CompassAnnouncementAcknowledgement {
        "The component that needs to acknowledge."
        component: CompassComponent @scopes(required: [READ_COMPASS_COMPONENT], product: COMPASS)

        "Whether the component has acknowledged the announcement or not."
        hasAcknowledged: Boolean
    }

    "Accepts input for creating a component announcement."
    input CompassCreateAnnouncementInput {
        "The ID of the component to create an announcement for."
        componentId: ID! @ARI(type: "component", owner: "compass")

        "The title of the announcement."
        title: String!

        "The description of the announcement."
        description: String

        "The date on which the changes in the announcement will take effect."
        targetDate: DateTime!
    }

    "The payload returned after creating a component announcement."

        "The created announcement."

        "Whether the mutation was successful or not."

        "A list of errors that occurred during the mutation."
        errors: [MutationError!]
    }

    "Accepts input for updating a component announcement."
    input CompassUpdateAnnouncementInput {
        "The cloud ID of the site to update an announcement on."
        cloudId: ID! @CloudID

        "The ID of the announcement being updated."
        id: ID!

        "The title of the announcement."
        title: String

        "The description of the announcement."
        description: String

        "The date on which the changes in the announcement will take effect."
        targetDate: DateTime

        "Whether the existing acknowledgements should be reset or not."
        clearAcknowledgements: Boolean
    }

    "The payload returned after updating a component announcement."
    type CompassUpdateAnnouncementPayload implements Payload {
        "The updated announcement."
        updatedAnnouncement: CompassAnnouncement

        "Whether the mutation was successful or not."
        success: Boolean!

        "A list of errors that occurred during the mutation."
        errors: [MutationError!]
    }

    "Accepts input for deleting a component announcement."
    input CompassDeleteAnnouncementInput {
        "The cloud ID of the site to delete an announcement from."
        cloudId: ID! @CloudID

        "The ID of the announcement to delete."
        id: ID!
    }

    "The payload returned after deleting a component announcement."
    type CompassDeleteAnnouncementPayload implements Payload {
        "The ID of the announcement that was deleted."
        deletedAnnouncementId: ID

        "Whether the mutation was successful or not."
        success: Boolean!

        "A list of errors that occurred during the mutation."
        errors: [MutationError!]
    }

    "Accepts input for acknowledging an announcement."
    input CompassAcknowledgeAnnouncementInput {
        "The ID of the announcement being acknowledged."
        announcementId: ID!

        "The ID of the component that is acknowledging the announcement."
        componentId: ID! @ARI(type: "component", owner: "compass")
    }

    "The payload returned after acknowledging an announcement."

        "The announcement acknowledgement."

        "Whether the mutation was successful or not."

        "A list of errors that occurred during the mutation."
        errors: [MutationError!]

    # COMPONENT DATA MANAGER

    "An external integration that manages data for a particular component."
    type CompassComponentDataManager {

        "The unique identifier (ID) of the ecosystem app acting as a component data manager."
        ecosystemAppId: ID!

        "An URL of the external source."
        externalSourceURL: URL

        "Details about the last sync event to this component."
        lastSyncEvent: ComponentSyncEvent
    }

    "Event data corresponding to a dataManager updating a component."
    type ComponentSyncEvent {

        "Timestamp when the last sync event occurred."
        time: DateTime!

        "Status of the last sync event."
        status: ComponentSyncEventStatus!

        "Error messages explaining why the last sync event may have failed."
        lastSyncErrors: [String!]
    }

    "Status types of a data manager sync event."
    enum ComponentSyncEventStatus {

        "The component updates were successfully synced to Compass."
        SUCCESS

        "An issue with the calling app or user input prevented the component from syncing to Compass."
        USER_ERROR

        "A Compass internal server issue prevented the sync from occurring."
        SERVER_ERROR
    }

    "Accepts input to attach a data manager to a component."
    input AttachCompassComponentDataManagerInput {

        "The ID of the component to attach a data manager to."
        componentId: ID! @ARI(type: "component", owner: "compass")

        "An URL of the external source of the component's data."
        externalSourceURL: URL
    }

    "The payload returned from attaching a data manager to a component."
    type AttachCompassComponentDataManagerPayload implements Payload {

        "Whether the mutation was successful or not."
        success: Boolean!

        "A list of errors that occurred during the mutation."
        errors: [MutationError!]

        "The details of the component that was mutated."
        componentDetails: CompassComponent @scopes(required: [READ_COMPASS_COMPONENT], product: COMPASS)
    }

    "Accepts input to detach a data manager from a component."
    input DetachCompassComponentDataManagerInput {

        "The ID of the component to detach a data manager from."
        componentId: ID! @ARI(type: "component", owner: "compass")
    }

    "The payload returned from detaching a data manager from a component."
    type DetachCompassComponentDataManagerPayload implements Payload {

        "Whether the mutation was successful or not."
        success: Boolean!

        "A list of errors that occurred during the mutation."
        errors: [MutationError!]

        "The details of the component that was mutated."
        componentDetails: CompassComponent @scopes(required: [READ_COMPASS_COMPONENT], product: COMPASS)
    }

    "Accepts input to update a data manager on a component."
    input UpdateCompassComponentDataManagerMetadataInput {
  
        "The ID of the component to update a data manager on."
        componentId: ID! @ARI(type: "component", owner: "compass")

        "A URL of the external source of the component's data."
        externalSourceURL: URL

        "Details about the last sync event to this component."
        lastSyncEvent: ComponentSyncEventInput
    }

    "Details on the result of the last component sync."
    input ComponentSyncEventInput {

        "Status of the last sync event."
        status: ComponentSyncEventStatus!

        "Error messages explaining why last sync event failed."
        lastSyncErrors: [String!]
    }

    "The payload returned from updating a data manager of a component."
    type UpdateCompassComponentDataManagerMetadataPayload implements Payload {

        "Whether the mutation was successful or not."
        success: Boolean!

        "A list of errors that occurred during the mutation."
        errors: [MutationError!]

        "The details of the component that was mutated."
        componentDetails: CompassComponent @scopes(required: [READ_COMPASS_COMPONENT], product: COMPASS)
    }

    # SCORECARD CONFIGURATION

    "The configuration for a scorecard that can be used by components."
    type CompassScorecard implements Node {
    "The unique identifier (ID) of the scorecard."
        id: ID! @ARI(type: "scorecard", owner: "compass")

        "The name of the scorecard."
        name: String!

        "The description of the scorecard."
        description: String

        "The criteria used for calculating the score."
        criterias: [CompassScorecardCriteria!]

        "The unique identifier (ID) of the scorecard's owner."
        owner: User @hydrated(service: "identity", field: "users", arguments : [{ name:"accountIds", value:"$source.ownerId"}], identifiedBy : "accountId", batchSize : 90 )

        "The type of component to which this scorecard is restricted."
        componentType: CompassComponentType!

        "Determines how the scorecard will be applied by default."
        importance: CompassScorecardImportance!

        "Returns the calculated total score for a given component."
        scorecardScore(query: CompassScorecardScoreQuery): CompassScorecardScore

        "Returns a list of components to which this scorecard is applied."
        appliedToComponents(query: CompassScorecardAppliedToComponentsQuery): CompassScorecardAppliedToComponentsQueryResult

        "Contains change metadata for the scorecard."
        changeMetadata: CompassChangeMetadata!
    }

    "The types used to identify the importance of the scorecard."
    enum CompassScorecardImportance {
        "Automatically applied to all components of the specified type or types and cannot be removed."
        REQUIRED

        "Recommended to the component's owner when they select a scorecard to apply to their component."
        RECOMMENDED

        "Custom scorecard, focused on specific use cases within teams or departments."
        USER_DEFINED
    }

    # SCORECARD SCORE

    "Scorecard score on a scorecard for a component."
    input CompassScorecardScoreQuery {
        "The unique identifier (ID) of the component."
        componentId: ID! @ARI(type: "component", owner: "compass")
    }

    "Scorecard score on a component for a scorecard."
    input CompassComponentScorecardScoreQuery {
        "The unique identifier (ID) of the scorecard."
        scorecardId: ID! @ARI(type: "scorecard", owner: "compass")
    }

    "Contains the calculated score for a component. Each component has one calculated score per scorecard."
    type CompassScorecardScore {
        "The total calculated score value."
        totalScore: Int!

        "The maximum possible total score value."
        maxTotalScore: Int!

        "Returns the scores for individual criterion."
        criteriaScores: [CompassScorecardCriteriaScore!]
    }

    # SCORECARD CRITERIA

    "The configuration for a scorecard criterion that can be shared across components."
    interface CompassScorecardCriteria {
        "The ID of the scorecard criterion."
        id: ID!

        "The weight that will be used in determining the aggregate score."
        weight: Int!

        "Returns the calculated score for a component."
        scorecardCriteriaScore(query: CompassScorecardCriteriaScoreQuery): CompassScorecardCriteriaScore
    }

    "The configuration for a scorecard criterion representing the presence of a link, for example, 'Has Repository', or 'Has Documentation'."
    type CompassHasLinkScorecardCriteria implements CompassScorecardCriteria {
        "The ID of the scorecard criterion."
        id: ID!

        "The weight that will be used in determining the aggregate score."
        weight: Int!

        "The type of link, for example 'Repository' if 'Has Repository'."
        linkType: CompassLinkType!

        "Returns the calculated score for a component."
        scorecardCriteriaScore(query: CompassScorecardCriteriaScoreQuery): CompassScorecardCriteriaScore
    }

    "The configuration for a scorecard criterion representing the presence of a field, for example, 'Has Tier'."
    type CompassHasFieldScorecardCriteria implements CompassScorecardCriteria {
        "The ID of the scorecard criterion."
        id: ID!

        "The weight that will be used in determining the aggregate score."
        weight: Int!

        "The target of a relationship, for example, 'Owner' if 'Has Owner'."
        fieldDefinition: CompassFieldDefinition!

        "Returns the calculated score for a component."
        scorecardCriteriaScore(query: CompassScorecardCriteriaScoreQuery): CompassScorecardCriteriaScore
    }

    "The configuration for a scorecard criterion representing the presence of a description."
    type CompassHasDescriptionScorecardCriteria implements CompassScorecardCriteria {
        id: ID!
        weight: Int!

        "Returns the calculated score for a given component"
        scorecardCriteriaScore(query: CompassScorecardCriteriaScoreQuery): CompassScorecardCriteriaScore
    }

    "Configuration for a scorecard criteria representing the presence of an owner"
    type CompassHasOwnerScorecardCriteria implements CompassScorecardCriteria {
        "The ID of the scorecard criterion."
        id: ID!

        "The weight that will be used in determining the aggregate score."
        weight: Int!

        "Returns the calculated score for a component."
        scorecardCriteriaScore(query: CompassScorecardCriteriaScoreQuery): CompassScorecardCriteriaScore
    }

    "The configuration for a scorecard criterion checking the value of a specified metric name."
    type CompassHasMetricValueScorecardCriteria implements CompassScorecardCriteria {
        "The ID of the scorecard criterion."
        id: ID!

        "The weight that will be used in determining the aggregate score."
        weight: Int!

        "The threshold value that the metric is compared to."
        comparatorValue: Float!

        "The ID of the component metric to check the value of."
        metricDefinitionId: ID!

        "The comparison operation to be performed between the metric and comparator value."
        comparator: CompassCriteriaNumberComparatorOptions!

        "Returns the calculated score for a component."
        scorecardCriteriaScore(query: CompassScorecardCriteriaScoreQuery): CompassScorecardCriteriaScore

        "Returns the metric definition this criteria uses."
        metricDefinition: CompassMetricDefinition
    }

        "Whether the action is completed or not."
        completed: Boolean
    }

    "Accepts input for updating a team checkin action."
    input CompassUpdateTeamCheckinActionInput {
        "The ID of the team checkin action item."
        id: ID!

        "The text of the team checkin action item."
        actionText: String

        "Whether the action is completed or not."
        completed: Boolean
    }

    "Accepts input for deleting a team checkin."
    input CompassDeleteTeamCheckinActionInput {
        "The ID of the team checkin item to delete."
        id: ID!
    }

    ####################################################################################################################
    # COMPASS METRICS
    ####################################################################################################################

    "A metric definition defines a metric across multiple components."
    type CompassMetricDefinition {
        "The unique identifier (ID) of the metric definition."
        id: ID!

        "The name of the metric definition."
        name: String

        "The description of the metric definition."
        description: String

        "The format option for applying to the display of metric values."
        format: CompassMetricDefinitionFormat
        
        "The type of the metric definition based on where the definition originated"
        type: CompassMetricDefinitionType!

        "A collection of metrics which contain values that provide numerical data."
        metricSources(query: CompassMetricSourcesQuery): CompassMetricSourcesQueryResult
    }

    input CompassMetricSourcesQuery {
        first: Int
        after: String
    }

    type CompassMetricSourcesConnection {
        edges: [CompassMetricSourceEdge!]
        nodes: [CompassMetricSource!]
        pageInfo: PageInfo!
    }

    union CompassMetricSourcesQueryResult = CompassMetricSourcesConnection | QueryError

    "The query to get the metric definitions on a Compass site."
    input CompassMetricDefinitionsQuery {
        "The cloud ID of the site to query for metric definitions on."
        cloudId: ID! @CloudID

        "The number of results to return in the query. The default is 10."
        first: Int

        "Returns results after the specified cursor."
        after: String
    }

    "A connection that returns a paginated collection of metric definitions."
    type CompassMetricDefinitionsConnection {
        "A list of edges which contain a metric definition and a cursor."
        edges: [CompassMetricDefinitionEdge!]

        "A list of metric definitions."
        nodes: [CompassMetricDefinition!]

        "Pagination information such as the start and end cursor of this page, and whether there is a next and previous page."
        pageInfo: PageInfo!
    }

    "An edge that contains a metric definition and a cursor."
    type CompassMetricDefinitionEdge {
        "The cursor of the metric definition."
        cursor: String!

        "The metric definition."
        node: CompassMetricDefinition
    }

    union CompassMetricDefinitionsQueryResult = CompassMetricDefinitionsConnection | QueryError

    "The input for creating a metric definition."
    input CompassCreateMetricDefinitionInput {
        "The cloud ID of the Compass site to create a metric definition on."
        cloudId: ID! @CloudID

        "The name of the metric definition."
        name: String!

        "The description of the metric definition."
        description: String

        "The format option for applying to the display of metric values."
        format: CompassMetricDefinitionFormatInput
    }

    "The payload returned from creating a metric definition."
    type CompassCreateMetricDefinitionPayload implements Payload {
        "Whether the mutation was successful or not."
        success: Boolean!

        "A list of errors that occurred during the mutation."
        errors: [MutationError!]

        "The created metric definition."
        createdMetricDefinition: CompassMetricDefinition
    }

    "The input to update a metric definition."
    input CompassUpdateMetricDefinitionInput {
        "The ID of the metric definition being updated."
        id: ID! @ARI(type: "metric-definition", owner: "compass")

        "The updated name of the metric definition."
        name: String

        "The updated description of the metric definition."
        description: String

        "The updated format option of the metric definition."
        format: CompassMetricDefinitionFormatInput
    }

    "The payload returned from updating a metric definition."
    type CompassUpdateMetricDefinitionPayload implements Payload {
        "Whether the mutation was successful or not."
        success: Boolean!

        "A list of errors that occurred during the mutation."
        errors: [MutationError!]

        "The updated metric definition."
        updatedMetricDefinition: CompassMetricDefinition
    }

    "The input to delete a metric definition."
    input CompassDeleteMetricDefinitionInput {
        "The ID of the metric definition to be deleted."
        id: ID! @ARI(type: "metric-definition", owner: "compass")
    }

    "The payload returned from updating a metric definition."
    type CompassDeleteMetricDefinitionPayload implements Payload {
        "Whether the mutation was successful or not."
        success: Boolean!

        "A list of errors that occurred during the mutation."
        errors: [MutationError!]

        "The ID of the deleted metric definition."
        deletedMetricDefinitionId: ID
    }

    union CompassMetricDefinitionFormat = CompassMetricDefinitionFormatSuffix

    "The format option to append a plain-text suffix to metric values."
    type CompassMetricDefinitionFormatSuffix {
        "A plain-text suffix appended to the metric value when displayed, for example, 'MB/s'."
        suffix: String
    }

    input CompassMetricDefinitionFormatInput @oneOf {
        "A plain-text suffix appended to the metric value when displayed, for example, 'MB/s'."
        suffix: CompassMetricDefinitionFormatSuffixInput
    }

    "The format option to append a plain-text suffix to metric values."
    input CompassMetricDefinitionFormatSuffixInput {
        "A plain-text suffix appended to the metric value when displayed, for example, 'MB/s'."
        suffix: String!
    }

    "Used to identify the type for the metric"
    enum CompassMetricDefinitionType {
        "Predefined metrics built in to Compass"
        BUILT_IN

        "Metrics defined by the individual user"
        CUSTOM
    }

    # Metric sources
    "A metric source contains values that provide numerical data about the component."
    type CompassMetricSource {
        "The unique identifier (ID) of the metric source on the Compass site."
        id: ID!

        "The metric definition that defines the metric source."
        metricDefinition: CompassMetricDefinition

        "The unique identifier (ID) of the metric source that is external to the Compass site, for example, a Bitbucket repository ID."
        externalMetricSourceId: ID

        "The URL of the metric source."
        url: String

        "A collection of values which store historical data points about the component."
        values(query: CompassMetricSourceValuesQuery): CompassMetricSourceValuesQueryResult

        "Compass component associated with this metric source."
        component: CompassComponent
    }

    "The input to create a metric source."
    input CompassCreateMetricSourceInput {
        "The ID of the component to create a metric source on."
        componentId: ID! @ARI(type: "component", owner: "compass")

        "The ID of the metric definition which defines the metric source."
        metricDefinitionId: ID! @ARI(type: "metric-definition", owner: "compass")

        "The unique identifier (ID) of the metric source that is external to the Compass site, for example, a Bitbucket repository ID."
        externalMetricSourceId: ID!

        "The URL of the metric source."
        url: String
    }

    "The payload returned from creating a metric source."
    type CompassCreateMetricSourcePayload implements Payload {
        "Whether the mutation was successful or not."
        success: Boolean!

        "A list of errors that occurred during the mutation."
        errors: [MutationError!]

        "The metric source that is created."
        createdMetricSource: CompassMetricSource
    }

    "The input to delete a metric source."
    input CompassDeleteMetricSourceInput {
        "The ID of the metric source to be deleted."
        id: ID! @ARI(type: "metric-source", owner: "compass")
    }

    "The payload returned from deleting a metric source."
    type CompassDeleteMetricSourcePayload implements Payload {
        "Whether the mutation was successful or not."
        success: Boolean!

        "A list of errors that occurred during the mutation."
        errors: [MutationError!]

        "The ID of the metric source that is deleted."
        deletedMetricSourceId: ID
    }

    union CompassComponentMetricSourcesQueryResult = CompassComponentMetricSourcesConnection | QueryError

    "A connection that returns a paginated collection of metric sources."
    type CompassComponentMetricSourcesConnection {
        "A list of edges which contain a metric source and a cursor."
        edges: [CompassMetricSourceEdge!]

        "A list of metric sources."
        nodes: [CompassMetricSource!]

        "Pagination information such as the start and end cursor of this page, and whether there is a next and previous page."
        pageInfo: PageInfo!
    }

    "An edge that contains a metric source and a cursor."
    type CompassMetricSourceEdge {
        "The cursor of the metric source."
        cursor: String!

        "The metric source."
        node: CompassMetricSource
    }

    "The query to get the metric sources of a component."
    input CompassComponentMetricSourcesQuery {
        "The number of results to return in the query. The default is 10."
        first: Int

        "Returns results after the specified cursor."
        after: String
    }

    # Metric Values
    "A metric value stores the numerical data relating to the component."
    type CompassMetricValue {
        "The timestamp representing when the metric value was collected."
        timestamp: DateTime

        "The value of the metric."
        value: Float
    }

    "The input to insert a metric value."
    input CompassInsertMetricValueInput {
        "The unique identifier (ID) of the metric source to insert the value into."
        metricSourceId: ID! @ARI(type: "metric-source", owner: "compass")

        "The metric value to be inserted."
        value: CompassMetricValueInput!
    }

    "A metric value to be inserted."
    input CompassMetricValueInput {
        "The timestamp representing when the metric value was collected."
        timestamp: DateTime!

        "The value of the metric."
        value: Float!
    }

    "The payload returned from inserting a metric value."
    type CompassInsertMetricValuePayload implements Payload {
        "Whether the mutation was successful or not."
        success: Boolean!

        "A list of errors that occurred during the mutation."
        errors: [MutationError!]

        "The metric source that the value was inserted into."
        metricSource: CompassMetricSource
    }

    "A connection that returns a paginated collection of metric values."
    type CompassMetricSourceValuesConnection {
        "A list of edges which contain a metric values and a cursor."
        edges: [CompassMetricValueEdge!]

        "A list of metric values."
        nodes: [CompassMetricValue!]

        "Pagination information such as the start and end cursor of this page, and whether there is a next and previous page."
        pageInfo: PageInfo!
    }

    "An edge that contains a metric value and a cursor."
    type CompassMetricValueEdge {
        "The cursor of the metric value."
        cursor: String!

        "The metric value."
        node: CompassMetricValue
    }

    union CompassMetricSourceValuesQueryResult = CompassMetricSourceValuesConnection | QueryError

    "The query to get the metric values from a component's metric source."
    input CompassMetricSourceValuesQuery {
        "The number of results to return in the query. The default is 10."
        first: Int

        "Returns the values after the specified cursor position."
        after: String
    }

cs_extensions:
"An arbitrary extension definition as defined by the Ecosystem"
type Extension {
    id: ID!
    definitionId: ID!
    environmentId: ID!
    environmentKey: String!
    environmentType: String!
    installationId: String!
    type: String!
    key: String!
    appOwner: User @hydrated(service: "identity", field: "users", arguments : [{ name:"accountIds", value:"$source.appOwner"}], identifiedBy : "accountId", batchSize : 90 )
    appVersion: String
    properties: JSON!
    license: AppInstallationLicense
    egress: [AppNetworkEgressPermissionExtension!]
    securityPolicies: [AppSecurityPoliciesPermissionExtension!]
    consentUrl: String
    currentUserConsent: UserConsentExtension
    requiresUserConsent: Boolean
}

type UserConsentExtension {
    user: UserConsentExtensionUser!
    appEnvironmentVersion: UserConsentExtensionAppEnvironmentVersion!
    consentedAt: DateTime!
}

type UserConsentExtensionUser {
    aaid: ID!
}

type UserConsentExtensionAppEnvironmentVersion {
    id: ID!
}

"The context in which an extension exists"
type ExtensionContext {
    id: ID!
    extensionsByType(type: String!): [Extension!]!
        appAuditLogs(first: Int, after: String ) : AppAuditConnection!
}

type AppInstallationLicense {
    active: Boolean!
    type: String
    supportEntitlementNumber: String
    trialEndDate: DateTime
    subscriptionEndDate: DateTime
    isEvaluation: Boolean
      billingPeriod: String
    }

    type AppAuditConnection {
      edges: [AuditEventEdge]
      """
      nodes field allows easy access for the first N data items
      """
      nodes: [AuditEvent]
      """
      pageInfo determines whether there are more entries to query.
      """
      pageInfo: AuditsPageInfo
    }

    type AuditsPageInfo {
      hasNextPage: Boolean!
      hasPreviousPage: Boolean!
    }

    type AuditEventEdge {
      cursor: String!
      node: AuditEvent
    }

    type AuditEvent {
      """
      Audit Event Id
      """
      id: ID!

      """
      The attributes of an audit event
      """
      attributes: AuditEventAttributes!

      """
      Message with content and format to be displayed
      """
      message: AuditMessageObject
    }

    type AuditEventAttributes {
      """
      The Actor who created the event
      """
      actor: User => hydrated from identity.users(accountIds: $source.actorId) object identified by accountId, batch size 90

      """
      The action for audit log event
      """
      action: String!

      """
      The time when the event occurred
      """
      time: String!

      """
      The Context EventObjects for this event
      """
      context: [ContextEventObject]!

      """
      The Container EventObjects for this event
      """
      container: [ContainerEventObject]!

    }

    type AuditMessageObject {
      content: String
      format: String
    }

    type ContextEventObject {
      id: ID!
      type: String!
      attributes: JSON!
    }

    type ContainerEventObject {
      id: ID!
      type: String!
      attributes: JSON!
}

type Query {
    extensionsEcho(text: String!): String @apiGroup(name: CAAS) @renamed(from : "echo")
    extensionContexts(contextIds: [ID!]!): [ExtensionContext!] @apiGroup(name: CAAS)
    extensionByKey(contextId: ID!, definitionId: ID!, extensionKey: String!): Extension @apiGroup(name: CAAS)
}

extend type AppInstallation {
    license: AppInstallationLicense @hydrated(service: "cs_extensions", field: "licenses", arguments : [{ name:"appInstallationLicenseDetails", value:"$source.appInstallationLicenseDetails"}], indexed:true, batchSize : 100 )
}

type AppNetworkEgressPermissionExtension {
    type: AppNetworkPermissionTypeExtension
    addresses: [String!]
}

type AppSecurityPoliciesPermissionExtension {
    type: AppSecurityPoliciesPermissionTypeExtension
    policies: [String!]
}

enum AppNetworkPermissionTypeExtension {
    NAVIGATION
    IMAGES
    MEDIA
    SCRIPTS
    STYLES
    FETCH_BACKEND_SIDE
    FETCH_CLIENT_SIDE
    FONTS
    FRAMES
}

enum AppSecurityPoliciesPermissionTypeExtension {
    SCRIPTS
    STYLES
}
cs_apps:
type Query {
    apps(first: Int, after: String, last: Int, before: String, filter: AppsFilter): AppConnection @apiGroup(name: CAAS)
    app(id: ID!): App @apiGroup(name: CAAS)
    "Returns information about all the scopes from different Atlassian products"
    appHostServices(filter: AppServicesFilter): [AppHostService!] @apiGroup(name: CAAS)
}

type Mutation {
  "Creates an application in Xen"
  createApp(input: CreateAppInput!): CreateAppResponse

  updateAppDetails(input: UpdateAppDetailsInput!): UpdateAppDetailsResponse

  "Deletes an application from Xen"
  deleteApp(input: DeleteAppInput!): DeleteAppResponse

  "Update Atlassian OAuth Client details"
  updateAtlassianOAuthClient(input: UpdateAtlassianOAuthClientInput!) : UpdateAtlassianOAuthClientResponse

  ecosystem: EcosystemMutation  @namespaced
}

type EcosystemMutation {
  """Update an app environment and enrol to new scopes"""
  updateAppHostServiceScopes(input: UpdateAppHostServiceScopesInput!) : UpdateAppHostServiceScopesResponsePayload
}

input DeleteAppInput {
    appId: ID!
}

"Response from deleting an app"
type DeleteAppResponse implements Payload {
    success: Boolean!
    errors: [MutationError!]
}

type AppConnection {
    edges: [AppEdge]
    nodes: [App]
    pageInfo: PageInfo!
    totalCount: Int
}

type AppEdge {
    cursor: String!
    node: App
}
input AppsFilter {
    isPublishable: Boolean
    migrationKey: String
}

input AppServicesFilter {
    name: String!
}

type App {
    id: ID!
    name: String!
    description: String!
    distributionStatus: String!
    avatarFileId: String
    createdBy: User @hydrated(service: "identity", field: "users", arguments : [{ name:"accountIds", value:"$source.createdByAccountId"}], identifiedBy : "accountId", batchSize : 90 )
    storesPersonalData: Boolean!
    privacyPolicy: String
    termsOfService: String
    contactLink: String
    vendorName: String
    environments: [AppEnvironment!]!
    environmentByKey(key: String!): AppEnvironment
    """
    A list of app tags.
    This is a beta field and can be changes without a notice.
    """
    tags: [String!] @beta(name: "AppTags")
}

enum AppEnvironmentType {
    DEVELOPMENT
    STAGING
    PRODUCTION
}

type AppEnvironment {
    id: ID!
    appId: ID!
    key: String!
    type: AppEnvironmentType!
    createdBy: User @hydrated(service: "identity", field: "users", arguments : [{ name:"accountIds", value:"$source.createdByAccountId"}], identifiedBy : "accountId", batchSize : 90 )
    createdAt: String!
    scopes: [String!] @deprecated(reason: "This has been superseeded by having scopes per version")
    """The list of major versions for this environment in reverse chronological order (i.e. latest versions first)"""
    versions(
        first: Int
        last: Int

        """Takes a version number for after query"""
        after: String

        """Takes a version number for before query"""
        before: String
    ): AppEnvironmentVersionConnection

    """
    Primary oauth client for the App to interact with Atlassian Authorisation server
    """
    oauthClient: AtlassianOAuthClient!
}

type RefreshToken {
    refreshTokenRotation: Boolean!
}

type AtlassianOAuthClient {
    "Identifier of the client for authentication"
    clientID: ID!
    "Callback url where the users are redirected once the authentication is complete"
    callbacks: [String!]
    "Rotating refresh token status for the auth client"
    refreshToken: RefreshToken
}

type AppEnvironmentVersionConnection {
    """A paginated list of AppEnvironmentVersions"""
    edges: [AppEnvironmentVersionEdge]

    """nodes field allows easy access for the first N data items"""
    nodes: [AppEnvironmentVersion]

    """pageInfo determines whether there are more entries to query"""
    pageInfo: PageInfo!

    """totalCount is the number of records retrieved on a query"""
    totalCount: Int
}

type AppEnvironmentVersionEdge {
    cursor: String!
    node: AppEnvironmentVersion
}

"""
Represents a major version of an AppEnvironment.
A major version is one that requires consent from end users before upgrading installations, typically a change in
the permissions an App requires.
Other changes do not trigger a new major version to be created and are instead applied to the latest major version
"""
type AppEnvironmentVersion {
    id: ID!
    """
    The semver for this version (e.g. 2.4.0)
    """
    version: String!

    """
    a flag which if true indicates this version is the latest major version for this environment
    """
    isLatest: Boolean!

    """
    A flag which indicates if this version requires a license
    """
    requiresLicense: Boolean!

    """
    The permissions that this app requires on installation. These must be consented to by the installer
    """
    permissions: [AppPermission!]!

    """
    A set of migrationKeys for each product corresponding to the Connect App Key
    """
    migrationKeys: MigrationKeys

    """Information about the types of storage being used by the app"""
    storage: Storage!
}

"""
Permissions that relate to the App's interaction with supported APIs and supported network egress
"""
type AppPermission {
    scopes: [AppHostServiceScope!]!
    egress: [AppNetworkEgressPermission!]
    securityPolicies: [AppSecurityPoliciesPermission!]
}

type AppHostServiceScope {
    key: String!
    name: String!
